title: Social environment helps determine attitudes toward risk

title_detail.value: Social environment helps determine attitudes toward risk

summary: Studies have shown women are more risk-averse than men, a trait experts say could help to explain the persistent wage gap between men and women. New research suggests those gender differences are shaped by culture and the social environment and that those differences can shift, at least in children.
